title: The Atomic Age: The World After 1945
description: Introduction to key economic, political, and societal changes at the global scale.

title: The Pre-Modern World
description: World history from the end of the 6th century to the 15th century.

title: The Early Modern World
description: World history from the 15th century through the 18th century.

title: The Modern World
description: The world since the beginning of the 19th century. Not open to students with credit in HIST 120.

title: The History of the World in the Last 10 Years
description: Global historical developments over the last 10 years with emphasis on the interaction of states and peoples.

title: Technology and History
description: The role of technology in historical developments around the world.

title: The Emergence of the Atlantic World
description: The history and legacies of the transatlantic slave trade that linked Europe, Africa, and the Americas, emphasizing economic, political, social and cultural ramifications.

title: Plague: Disease and Epidemics in History
description: The causes, impacts, and experiences of disease in human history.

title: History of Sexuality in the Americas
description: History of sexual behaviour, identities, and regulations in the Western Hemisphere from the colonial era through the twentieth century.

title: Drugs in Modern Global History
description: The social, cultural, and political histories of criminalized drugs like opium, marijuana, amphetamines, and cocaine.

title: War, Revolution, and Society
description: The causes, course, and consequences of major conflicts around the globe, including their wider social effects.

title: Democracy, War and Consumer Capitalism: The Making of Modern Europe
description: European history from the Enlightenment to the present.

title: Global History of Alchemy: Quests for Gold, Power, and Immortality
description: Theories and practices of ancient and medieval alchemy in its historical and cultural contexts.

title: Origins of Ancient India: Cities, Migrations and Peoples
description: Introduction to the formative period of South Asian history, from approximately 3000 BCE to 600 CE, covering the Harappan civilization, Indo-European migration, and the first kingdoms of the Ganges valley.

title: Sex Work and Intimate Labour in Global History
Video Games, History, and Storytelling
description: The use of world history in video games.

title: Warfare Since 1789: From Mass Armies to Thermonuclear War
History of Computing
description: Survey of the history of computers, computing, and human/computer interactions.

title: Capitalism
description: The development of global capitalism through an exploration of historical changes in trade, markets, ideas, work, consumption, and government policies.

title: From Constantine to the Cathedral: Europe in the Middle Ages
description: A survey of Europe from the fourth to the thirteenth century.

title: Early Modern Europe
description: A survey of European history from approximately 1200 to 1800.

title: Famine as Genocide in the 20th Century: The Case of the Holodomor
description: Exploration of the 1932-33 famine in Ukraine in the context of other 20th century famines, genocide, survivor experience, and Soviet history.

title: The Making of the Modern Middle East
description: Twentieth-century political and cultural history, following the Ottoman Empire's disintegration

title: The Pacific World Since 1500
description: Exploration, migration, trade, and geopolitics in the Pacific region, connecting Australia and the Pacific Islands with Asia and coastal North and South America.

title: Colonial Latin America
description: Survey of Latin American history to 1810.

title: Modern Latin America
description: Survey of Latin American history since 1810.

title: The Golden Age of Islam: History of the Muslim World to the 16th Century
description: Historical overview of the rise of Islam in seventh century Arabia and the political, economic and cultural impact of subsequent expansion into Asia, Africa and Europe.

title: Africa from Medieval to Modern Times
description: African history to the 19th century.

title: Africa in the 20th and 21st Centuries: From Colonial Rule to Modern Nations
description: African history since the 19th century.

title: American History to 1865
description: Survey of United States history from colonial times to the Civil War.

title: From the End of Slavery to the Present: American History Since 1865
description: Survey of United States history from the Civil War to the present.

title: Slavery in the Americas
description: Comparative examination of slavery in the Western Hemisphere from its creation to abolition.

title: Religion in History
description: A study of a religious tradition(s), its teachings and rituals, along with its function in a specific historical setting, including its role in conditioning and reflecting a particular society and culture.

title: East Asia to 1500
description: Survey of history of East Asia (China, Korea, Japan, Vietnam) to 1500.

title: East Asia from 1500
description: Survey of the history of East Asia (China, Korea, Japan, Vietnam) from 1500 to the present.

title: China and the West
description: A survey of Chinese-Western cultural interactions from the time of Marco Polo to the present.

title: Classical India to 500 CE
description: The world of Classical India, from the emergence of the Mauryan Empire in the fourth century BCE to the close of the Gupta Empire in the fifth century CE.

title: Introduction to History as a Discipline
description: Introduction to the basic concepts of historical inquiry and techniques of research and writing in History. Course includes lectures and discussions. Required for History majors. Prerequisite: A previous course in History or consent of the Department.

title: World War One
description: The European conflict and its global dimensions, with an emphasis on political, social, and cultural histories.

title: Medieval India from 500 to 1500 CE
description: A survey of the history of India from the close of the Gupta and Vakataka kingdoms in the fifth century CE to the decline of the Delhi Sultanate and the Vijayanagara Empire in the sixteenth century CE.

title: History of Science, Technology and Medicine: Key Moments
description: Pivotal events in the history of science, technology, and medicine using a wide variety of historical sources, such as photographs, artifacts, films, letters, and diaries.

title: An Introduction to the History of Sciences, Technology, and Medicine
description: Broad survey of topics in the history of science, technology, and medicine.

title: 20th-Century Warfare
description: In-depth look at some of the conflicts of the 20th century, the course examines wars and revolutions including the two world wars, the Korean and Vietnam wars, African guerrilla wars, and the Gulf War. Analyze the causes and consequences of war and the evolution of weaponry. To be offered in alternate years.

title: World War Two
description: The global conflict, with emphasis on political, social, scientific, and cultural aspects.

title: The History of Christianity
description: Lecture and discussion course about the development of Christian traditions in the world.

title: State and Society in Mughal India
description: A political and social history of India from the 16th-19th centuries, focusing on the Mughal empire.

title: Gandhi, Resistance, and Non-violence
description: Introduction to the history and legacy of Mahatma Gandhi. Topics may include Gandhi's influence on India's national freedom movement from colonial rule, his application of non-violence as a method of resistance, and the ways in which his religious worldview shaped his ideology and actions.

title: Europe in the Age of Total War, 1890-1945
description: European experience with total war, economic crisis, cultural change and totalitarian regimes in the new era of mass politics and Great Power conflict.

title: Germany in the 20th Century and Beyond
description: The economic, social, cultural, and political histories of the various Germanies in their European and global contexts, from 1900 to the present.

title: Saints and Medieval Christianity
description: Beginning with the early Christian background, this course treats the various forms of sanctity (martyrs, monks and clerics) that appeared in medieval Europe, along with the social functions that the cult of the saints fulfilled in the world of Late Antiquity and the Middle Ages.

title: Sexuality and Gender in Modern Europe
description: Introduction to the social organization, cultural construction, and political dimensions of sexuality and gender in Europe from the eighteenth to the twenty-first centuries.

title: The History of Paris
description: Introduction to the history of Paris from late antiquity to the present day, drawing on film, music, art, philosophy, geography, architecture, and literature.

title: A History of the Habsburg Monarchy, 1526-1918
description: The multinational empire of the Habsburgs from the unification of Austria, Bohemia and Hungary to the destruction of the empire in World War I.

title: History of Vienna
description: Introduction to the history of Vienna from prehistoric times to the present day, drawing on film, music, art, geography, architecture, and literature.

title: Foundations of East European History
description: The ethnic, religious, social, and political factors which shaped the development of the peoples of Eastern Europe from the Middle Ages through the Age of Enlightenment. Intended as background to the later histories of the Balkans, 'Central Europe', and Ukraine.

title: Medieval and Early Imperial Russia
description: Russia from Kievan Rus' through Catherine the Great's reign, 900s to 1800. Note: Not open to students with credit in HIST 318.

title: Topics in Global History
description: Addresses historical processes or themes affecting diverse areas of the world. Can be repeated if course content varies.

title: Modern Ukraine
description: Ukrainian history from the late eighteenth century to the present. Note: Not open to students with credit in HIST 315, 316, or 317.

title: Russia from Reform to Revolution, 1800-1917
description: Reaction, reform, and revolution, from Paul I to Nicholas II. Note: Not open to students with credit in HIST 318.

title: Russia in the 20th Century
description: An historical survey of domestic and foreign policy, from Nicholas II to Yeltsin.

title: The Middle East in the Making: 1300-1920
description: The rise and demise of the Ottoman Empire. An overview of the religious, cultural and political making of current-day North Africa, Near and Middle East, and Eastern Mediterranean. HIST 111 and 112 are recommended but not required.

title: Topics in History at the Movies
description: Provides students with the historical tools to analyze history as it is presented in movies. Topics will vary according to the instructor(s).

title: Topics in Indigenous History
description: Addresses select themes in the histories of Indigenous peoples. Can be repeated if course content varies.

title: The Modern British Empire and the Commonwealth Experience
Global Environmental History
description: Histories of interactions between non-human nature and diverse cultures, with attention to inequality and environmental change.

title: Slavery and Abolition in Africa
description: Explores slave trading out of Africa, domestic slavery within it, and European policies that were used to justify conquering and colonizing the continent. Course materials may include primary documents and images, slave narratives, historical fiction, and videos.

title: History of Women in the United States
description: A multicultural and multiracial history of women from the colonial period to the present.

title: African American History from Slavery to Black Power
description: The African American experience in the United States from the colonial era to the present.

title: History of American Medicine
description: The social history of American health care and health practitioners. How sickness, health, and healing have changed over the course of American history.

title: Canadian Environmental History
description: Brings the natural environment onto a shared stage with social, economic, political and cultural history in Canada from the last ice age to the present.

title: History of Alberta
description: Economic, social, and political realities that underlie the many images of Alberta.

title: The Canadian West to 1885
description: Native diplomacy and warfare, the development of fur trade societies, and European colonization to the suppression of the North-West Rebellion.

title: The Canadian West Since 1885
description: Economic, social, and political aspects of regional alienation, identity, and protest.

title: Histories of Indigenous Peoples and Kanata until 1870
description: Examines selected themes of the histories of Indigenous Peoples in what is now known as Canada (or Kanata, a word in Iroquoian meaning village or settlement) from Time Immemorial until 1870.

title: Histories of Indigenous Peoples and Kanata after 1870
description: Examines selected themes of the histories of Indigenous Peoples in what is now known as Canada (or Kanata, a word in Iroquoian meaning village or settlement) after 1870.

title: Making War in Canada
description: History of war and conflict within Canada.

title: Peasants, Slaves and Workers
description: The history of work regimes and regulation from feudalism to the present.

title: Canada Since 1945
description: Economic, political, social and cultural developments in the postwar era.

title: Topics in the History of the United States
Religion in Modern Europe
description: Religious revival and secularization in Europe from the French Revolution to the present. Topics include: relations between church and state; intellectual challenges and responses; and religion transformed by modernity.

title: The Civilization and Culture of Early China
description: This course focuses on the formative periods of Chinese civilization from prehistory to circa 600.

title: History of Chinese Philosophy
description: Historical development of the major philosophical traditions in pre-modern China.

title: Modern China
description: The history of China from the late nineteenth century to the present. Prerequisites: 3 units from EASIA 101, HIST 280, 281, 285 or 290, or consent of Department.

title: History of Science in Ancient and Classical India
description: Indigenous scientific activities and achievements of ancient and classical India, from 500 BCE to 1400 CE.

title: History of Indian Yoga and Meditation
description: The history and philosophy of early Yoga, exploring its focus on meditation, its literature, its connections with Buddhism, and its historical evolution. HIST 110, 289, or CLASS 110 are recommended but not required.

title: Imperial China from circa 600 to 1911
description: The institutional and social history of imperial China from the Tang to the Manchu Ch'ing dynasties.

title: Ancient India- Diversity in History
description: Taking the case of ancient India, this course highlights how diversity can be explained in a multicultural society and how it defines the character of civilization on the sub-continent.

title: History of Astronomy and Cosmology from Stonehenge to the Space Age
description: An examination of the major themes in the history of astronomy and cosmology from the ancient world to the present day.

title: History of Science II
description: Introduction to the intellectual, institutional, and ideological development of science, from Newtonianism to the present day.

title: Topics in the History of the Habsburg Monarchy
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Medieval European History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Fashion and Material Culture c. 1600-1900
description: The evolution and practice of fashion as a social, economic, political and cultural phenomenon from a cross-cultural perspective. Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of Modern Germany
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Eastern European History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Soviet History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of Early Modern Europe
description: Thematic studies in European cultural, religious, and social history emphasizing popular culture and religion. Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of Europe
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Reading Arabic Texts
description: Guided reading of Arabic sources central to Islamic Studies. Readings are in Arabic, class discussion and written assignments will be English. Sources may include religious, legal, and historical texts. Prerequisite: ARAB 211 or equivalent, or the consent of the department. May be repeated for credit when course content differs. Not open to students with credits in RELIG 421.

title: Topics in Indian History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of Christianity
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in British History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Latin American History Since 1850
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Transnational History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Themes and Issues in African History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Advanced Topics in Middle East History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in American History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Canadian History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Indian Residential Schooling in Canada
description: Histories of Indian Residential Schools in Canada, with attention to the roles of imperialism, colonialism, and racial ideologies in the implementation and eventual dismantling of the Residential Schools system. Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: History of Edmonton
description: Themes in the history of Edmonton from the 19th century fur trade to the present day. Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Alberta History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Methods and Historiography
description: Prerequisite: HIST 290 and 3 units in HIST at the 300- level, or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of the Canadian North
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Indigenous Histories - Global and Local
description: Addresses select themes in the histories of Indigenous peoples in global, comparative, and/or local contexts. Can be repeated if course content varies. Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Chinese History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in Asian HIST or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of Technology
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of Medicine
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in British Empire and Commonwealth History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Mediterranean History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department

title: Topics in War and Society
description: Addresses topics examining the impact of military conflict on society. Can be repeated if course content varies. Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Comparative History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in the History of Science
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Directed Study
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Topics in Oral History
description: Prerequisite: 3 units in HIST at the 300-level or consent of Department.

title: Methodology and Historiography for Honors Students
Methodology and Historiography for Honors Students
Special Subject, Fourth Year Honors History
description: Preparation of the Honors essay, required in the fourth year of the Honors program.

title: Special Subject, Fourth Year Honors History
description: Preparation of the Honors essay, required in the fourth year of the Honors program.

title: Research Methods and Resources in History
The Application of the Social Sciences to History
Topics in the Nature of Historical Controversy
Comprehensive Topic Course
description: Historiographical course focused on one of the department's designated graduate fields of study. May be repeated for credit when course content differs. Prerequisite: consent of instructor.

title: Directed Study
description: This credit/fail course is required for students in the thesis-based M.A. program. Students are introduced to scholarship relevant to their research and supported in developing a research proposal.

title: Topics in the History of Medieval and Early Modern Europe
Fashion and Material Culture: Politics, Economies, Societies, c. 1600-1900
Topics in the History of Europe
Topics in Reading Arabic Texts
description: Guided reading of Arabic sources central to Islamic Studies. Readings are in Arabic, class discussion and written assignments will be English. Sources may include religious, legal, and historical texts. Prerequisite: ARAB 211 or equivalent, or the consent of the department. May be repeated for credit when course content differs. Not open to students with credit in RELIG 521.

title: Topics in the History of Christianity
Problems in Modern East European History
The Rise of Consumer Society: Comparative Explorations of Culture, Society and Economy, c. 1500-1900
Slavery and Anti-Slavery in the United States
Indian Residential Schooling in Canada
description: Histories of Indian Residential Schools in Canada, with attention to the roles of imperialism, colonialism, and racial ideologies in the implementation and eventual dismantling of the Residential Schools system.

title: History of Edmonton
description: Themes in the history of Edmonton from the 19th century fur trade to the present day.

title: Topics in Indigenous Histories - Global and Local
description: Addresses select themes in the histories of Indigenous peoples in global, comparative, and/or local contexts. Can be repeated when course content varies.

title: Topics in Latin American History Since 1850
Topics in the History of the Sciences
Topics in the History of Technology
Topics in the History of Medicine
Graduate Research and Writing
description: Research-intensive course in which students prepare and defend an article-length primary-source-based research paper. May be repeated for credit in different years as course content necessarily differs. Prerequisite: consent of Department.

title: Comprehensives and Candidacy Colloquium
description: Preparation for the comprehensive and candidacy exams. Prerequisite: consent of Department.

title: Conference Course
description: Not open to graduate students in the Department of History.

title: Conference Course
description: Not open to graduate students in the Department of History.

title: Advanced Topics in Historical Study
description: Not open to graduate or honors students in the Department of History.
